instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.CPUIMVP_VR_ON: What is CPUIMVP_VR_ON? CPUIMVP_VR_ON is a signal that tells the buck converter responsible for PPVCORE_S0_CPU to turn on and create CPU vcore voltage. This comes from ALL_SYS_PWRGD â€“ once ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present, CPUIMVP_VR_ON will be present. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime
threads.message:
hi all,

got liquid spil around t29 area and smc,

cleaned it and replaced bad comps,
now i got fan spin and green light  but no chime.



<SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>                          1.115v
<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TON</SIGNAL>                331.8 ohm measured from the pins
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP</SIGNAL>      12.55v
CPUVCORE ENABLE = <RESISTOR>R7974</RESISTOR>  both sides 3.3volt
<CHIP>U7400</CHIP>                   <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> 3.3v
                               <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_CPUIMVP</SIGNAL>  (VCC) = 5v
Replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
Everything measure the same.
 
<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_UGATE1G</SIGNAL>                     0v
<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_PHASE1G</SIGNAL>                      0v
<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_LGATE1G</SIGNAL>                      0v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime
threads.message: You have CPU Vcore, why mess with <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>???

threads.message:
because i was beeing a dumbass duke..

threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 5099"]USB mouse lighting up? Beeps without RAM?[/QUOTE]

What are you verifying with this? Sorry if it sounds stupid

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime
threads.message: very good question, also wanted to ask that.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime
threads.message:
USB mouse will only light up if USB is initialized. This means the board has to be working for the most part.
RAM beeps confirm the CPU is running and the board is at least starting to run POST.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime
threads.message:
FIXED!!!
reballed SMC, i did a reflow on the smc nothing, but when i removed it it had a moist stain on a few legs.
reballed and replaced,
got a looooooooooooooooooooooooooonngggg dong
